section: Due Dates and Delays. Company guarantees to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. <*$p$*>Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are not subject to any delay.
explanation: This section creates an in-text contradiction. While it mentions a guaranteed delivery timeframe (February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018), it also states that due dates are not subject to any delay. This is contradictory because delays are common with projects of this nature.

section: <*$p$*>Client may elect to pay Company the Hourly Rate set forth below to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction, as the document does not specify what the hourly rate is. It is an omission of information that the client needs in order to make a decision about their content.

section: Payment Terms. Upon the signing of this Agreement, Client agrees to pay to Company a total of $5,000. Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work.
explanation: The payment terms in Section 2 create ambiguity. While it states the total amount ($5,000), the prepayment ($1,900), and remaining amount ($3,100), it doesn't include any deadlines for when the payments are due. This omission could cause disputes.
